cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 555 miles east of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest later today, then west-southwest on Tuesday and Wednesday, moving near the northwestern Bahamas Wednesday and making landfall along Florida’s east-central coast Wednesday night before crossing the Peninsula toward the eastern Gulf of Mexico and the southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida east-central coast (near the Treasure Coast/Palm Beach vicinity)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect only for the northwestern Bahamas at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas, entire Florida Peninsula (both coasts), and portions of the southeast U.S. coast from Georgia to the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph gusts) possible Thursday as Nicole’s center passes nearby.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible in and near Tampa Bay and the lower west-central Florida coast if the center emerges into the Gulf just north of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with locally higher totals, producing localized flooding and drainage issues at port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Choppy seas and very rough nearshore wave action that will hamper vessel movements; isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain bands.
